Sentencas: In this research, the performance evaluation of methane (CH4) steam reforming in Wall Steam-methane Reformer (WCR), intended to supply hydrogen (H-2) to SOFC, is investigated using homemade code based on 2D numerical modeling.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency

Sentencas: Focus is on the design of the catalyst coating on the walls of reactor.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency

Sentencas: Various designs of nickel-based catalyst coating were closely examined and compared purporting to understand their effect on the WCR efficiency.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency

Sentencas: The WCR designs operate at similar industrial operating conditions and with the same catalyst density.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency

Sentencas: The computations were discussed with respect to the possible improvement on WCR efficiency.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency

Sentencas: Comparing to the worst catalyst design found, the CH4 conversion rate improving is estimated to 31%, which corresponds to 95.8% more in H-2 production.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency

Sentencas: The obtained results are of practical importance for the design of the catalyst coating and saving fuel energy.
Titulo: Numerical analysis of catalytic-coated walls of an indirect internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell: Influence of catalyst coating distribution on the reformer efficiency
